result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas N. Stoltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
OWI 5th

Conditions:

Pay fine and all costs (to be paid out of the bond that has been posted in this case).

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  Do not enter into any bars or taverns.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Serve 1 year conditional jail time, with huber, in the Richland County Jail.  Jail to begin immediately.

Submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant to receive 1 day credit in the event of revocation.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Lab test results - presented to the Court during the sentencing - def's BAC
Statement of Negotiated Plea

Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA presents Court with statement of negotiated plea; states that the parties are ready to proceed today to plea/sentencing.  Court's colloquy with def re plea waiver.  Def pleads guilty to OWI 5th.  Further colloquy.  Finding of guilty.  BAC results were .182.  DA and Atty. Anderson address the Court re sentencing.  Defense requests huber for work release.  Court withholds sentence for probation of 2 years, 6 months.  Conditions:  Pay $600 fine plus costs.  AODA/follow through with treatment.  No possession/consumption of alcohol.  No entry into any taverns.  DL revoked for 3 years.  No operation of mv unless it has IID inserted; install IID in any mv owned/titled; IID requirement of 3 years begins when license is reinstated.  1 year conditional jail time, with huber.  1 day jail credit in the event of revocation.  $66 blood draw costs. $250 DNA surcharge with DNA sample to be submitted.  Total on the fine is $1519.  Together with the $250 DNA surcharge and $66 blood draw costs, the total is $1835.  Court orders that amount taken out of the $12k bond with the remainder to be refunded to the poster.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-25-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires re status.  Atty. A states the parties are close to resolution; asks for recess to talk with the prosecutor.  Court allows parties opportunity to talk.  Parties come back and advise that they have an agreement.  Plea/sentencing set for 9 a.m. 9/25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF36 and 15CF38/adjourned initial in both.  DA Harper moves to dismiss 15CF38.  So ordered.  In 15CF36, Atty. Anderson/Defense has moved for substitution.  Request granted.  15CF36 will be set for adjourned initial/status with the new judge, once assigned.
of Judge (request granted by Judge Sharp 6/3/15)
Adjourned initial appearance at 06-03-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adj. initial for both 15CF36 and 15CF38.  Def states he thought Atty. D Anderson was going to be here.  Clerk attempts to reach Atty. A by phone; no result.  Court resets these matters to June 3 at 9.  Def is directed to notify Atty. Anderson of the date/time as there is no notice of retainer in either file so clerk will provide def with the notice but no one else.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 05-27-2015 03:30 pm

15CF36 and 15CF38.  Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz in court, having turned himself in on the warrants in these matters. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA asks for 15k signature bond in the newest case and that def be readmitted to bond in the previous case.  Def has received the complaint in the 36 case but not the 38 case; DA to provide that today.  Court has informed def of his right to counsel.  Def presently employed full-time; will not qualify for SPD.  Def states he has already retained Atty. D Anderson.  Court quashes the warrants in these matters and adjourns the initials to May 27 at 3:30.  Court instructs def to advise Atty. Anderson that he needs to file retainer; in meantime, notices will go to def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Thomas N. Stoltz not in court. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendent is not in custody. State request warrant, so ordered.
